subject_geographic 1: The Great Depression and World War II (1929-1945).
abstract: This photograph depicts typical living quarters of the 223rd Company C.C.C., TVA P-10 in Powell Station, Tennessee. Inside the wooden barracks, metal bunks are neatly arranged with heads and feet facing opposite directions. Wooden trunks lie at the end of each bed and laundry bags hang from the walls. Otto F. Haslbauer donated this photograph, which was printed by Spencer and Wyckoff of Detroit, Michigan.

abstract: This photograph shows five members of the Civilian Conservation Corps headquarters personnel of the 223rd Company, TVA P-10, in Powell Station, Tennessee. The room has wooden desks, a typewriter, file cabinets, file boxes, a coal-burning stove. In the back of the room, there is an organizational chart for the company that shows a division of five work crews and other personnel. donor: Haslbauer, Otto F. Photo reads Spencer and Wyckoff, Detroit

subject_topical 5: Oak Ridge and WWII effort in Tennessee
subject_geographic 2: The Great Depression and World War II (1929-1945).
abstract: Dorothy Gracy, daughter of a Middle Tennessee State College professor, flips Sopjes in a jiu-jitsu demonstration. During a homefront war bond rally on the Murfreesboro public square, the College Training Detachment hosted demonstrations and speeches for the entertainment of the assembled crowd.
